titles: The auncient order, societie, and unitie laudable, of Prince Authure, and his knightly armory of the Round Table With a threefold assertion frendly in fauour and furtherance of English archery at this day. Translated and collected by R.R.
Devise des armes des chevaliers de la table ronde. English.
author: Robinson, Richard, citizen of London.
publisher: Imprinted by [R. Jones for] Iohn Wolfe dwelling in Distaffe lane neere the signe of the Castle,
notes: Colophon reads: At London printed by R.I. for Iohn VVolf: dwelling in Distaffe Lane, ouer-against the signe of the Castle.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
keywords: Archery in literature --  Early works to 1800.
